page.title: 09EYES DOWN
page.content: On my {BIRD'S EYE VIEW}I spy the Firth of Forth and the twisting coastline bordering our area - the rocks out at sea - The Wrecked Craigs, The Long Craigs and Fernyness - the long stretch of Seton Sands holiday and caravan centre nearby - 4 little streams flowing South to North into the Firth - Longniddry Golf Course - different coloured farmer's fields covering most of the land - the houses of Cockenzie, Port Seton and Longniddry - important buildings like the churches, our school, Cockenzie House, Port Seton Pond Hall and the historic Seton Collegiate Church - the dual carriageway part of the A198 and , following the same route, the main East Coust railway line to London.
